info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 9:33PM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Union NC. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 PM EST, Stream gauges across Union County in North Carolina show elevated levels late this evening, with minor flooding already occurring. Additional showers and embedded thunderstorms will move back into Union County from the south through midnight, producing additional one-half inch per hour rainfall rates. Minor flooding is expected to continue or worsen late this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroe, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Wingate, Waxhaw, Marshville, Lake Park, Mineral Springs, Hemby Bridge, Marvin, Fairview In Union County, Sturdivants, Jaars and Trinity. - Flooding is most likely along Bearskin Creek at North Charlotte Avenue near Monroe, and also along Goose Creek at Mill Grove Road near Indian Trail. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
